name: places/ChIJNxrsD3r2wokR6DuiGlBnnlA
formattedAddress: 217 W 140th St, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 217 W 140th St, New York, NY 10030, USA

originalText.text: Should I give them any stars? I put in a hold mail request for a very important package because I don't have a fixed address. Do you think they followed through on the request? No. Something needs to be done about the post offices in this city. I went to 34th Street to fill out a change of address form and was told that USPS only processes these things online when that's not true. Are these folks paid minimum wage or something?

originalText.text: RUN,  to any other post office downtown!!! I know it's an inconvenience,  but every negative thing that was said about this post office applies to the one on 125th street as well. This one opened my package from Amazon , then re-taped it. Amazon uses black tape on the packages I received,  but I noticed  part of the tape was that light brown color.  No matter who you complained to, they are all nasty, rude, and unprofessional.

originalText.text: The service is adequate, but if you're going to be viewing social media while you're working, at least put your phone under the desk when servicing customers. It gives the impression that your phone is more important than what you're doing. Contrary to popular opinion, people do notice.

text.text: The service is adequate, but if you're going to be viewing social media while you're working, at least put your phone under the desk when servicing customers. It gives the impression that your phone is more important than what you're doing. Contrary to popular opinion, people do notice.

originalText.text: Inefficient and rude service. My package was ‘attempted’ to be delivered on 9/3, even though I was home the entire day and and other carriers had no problem making their deliveries. I went to check for a delivery attempt notice slip but one wasn’t left. As it was typical for there not to be a slip as attempts aren’t actually made, I went to pick up my delivery on 9/5 as it was stated in the tracking information. After waiting on line in a ventless and AC less area for my package as instructed by the tracking information on the USPS site, I’m told I have to come back because my package wasn’t there even though the clerk didn’t try to go look for my package.

originalText.text: Worst post office experience. The laziness and rudeness from the workers is insane. They literally denied me a package due to the fact that they didn't want to go into the back and look for it. I had to come back a couple days later and hope that the worker on the job had the grace in her day to find my package. Typically I would understand with someone working in a job that deals with people all day, however this level of negligance and genuine laziness is ubsurd. Also, the package that I was denied had MEDICATION! I let the worker know this but still refused. Please get this place shut down ASAP.
